page.title: 16Mining-Devon Great Consols
page.content: North of Gunnislake,on the Devon side of the Tamar is{Devon Great {Consols}which once used to be the most productive lode for copper in Europe. This was composed of several mines:{a)Wheal Maria, {b)Wheal Fanny, {c)Wheal Anna Maria, {d)Wheal Josiah, {e)Wheal Emma. The most notable feature of this area today is the{barren surroundings due {to the arsenic waste}dumped during the extraction of copper and arsenic, and the stacks at the heads of the five mines. The mineworkers' cottages built by the Duke of Bedford still stand but are privately owned and greatly modernised. The forestry surrounding the area serves only to enhance the complete lack of vegetation.
